action: Disability: Agreement does not apply to warships, military aircraft or naval auxiliaries.
Duty: Shall ensure, so far as is reasonable and practicable, that such vessels/aircraft act consistently with the Agreement.
Duty: Shall interpret and apply the Agreement in a manner consistent with the Convention.
Immunity: Rights, jurisdiction and duties under the Convention are not prejudiced by this Agreement.
Duty: Shall interpret and apply so as not to undermine and to promote coherence and coordination with relevant instruments, frameworks and bodies.
Immunity: Legal status with regard to the Convention or related agreements is not affected by this Agreement.
Disability: Shall not rely on this Agreement to assert or deny sovereignty, sovereign rights or jurisdiction.
Duty: Shall be guided by listed principles and approaches (e.g., polluter-pays, equity, precaution, best available science).
Duty: Must cooperate for conservation and sustainable use in ABNJ, including by strengthening and enhancing cooperation with and among relevant instruments, frameworks and bodies.
Duty: Shall endeavour to promote the Agreement’s objectives in other relevant decision-making processes.
Duty: Must promote international cooperation in marine scientific research and in the development and transfer of marine technology.
Power: May make a written exception under Article 70 at signature/ratification/approval/acceptance/accession, excluding pre-entry utilization from application.
Immunity: Obligations in this Part do not apply to a Party’s military activities; obligations do apply to non-military activities.
Liberty: May carry out MGR/DSI activities in ABNJ (subject to the Agreement).
Duty: Must carry out such MGR/DSI activities in accordance with the Agreement.
Duty: Must promote cooperation in all MGR/DSI activities.
Duty: Must carry out collection in situ with due regard for the rights and legitimate interests of coastal States, and with due regard for the interests of other States.
Disability: Cannot claim or exercise sovereignty or sovereign rights over MGR of ABNJ; no such claim shall be recognized.
Disability: Collection in situ of MGR of ABNJ does not constitute a legal basis for any claim to any part of the marine environment or its resources.
Duty: Must carry out MGR/DSI activities exclusively for peaceful purposes.
Duty: Must take measures to ensure information is notified to the Clearing-House Mechanism in accordance with this Part.
Duty: Must notify the nature and objectives of planned in situ collection (and any programme(s) it forms part of).
Duty: Must notify the research subject matter or, if known, targeted MGR and the purposes for collection.
Duty: Must notify the geographical areas of collection.
Duty: Must notify a summary of methods/means, including vessel name/tonnage/type/class and equipment/study methods.
Duty: Must notify information on other contributions to proposed major programmes.
Duty: Must notify expected dates of first appearance and final departure of research vessels, or equipment deployment/removal.
Duty: Must notify sponsoring institution(s) and person in charge.
Duty: Must notify opportunities for scientists of all States, in particular from developing States, to be involved or associated.
Duty: Must notify how States needing/requesting technical assistance (in particular developing States) can participate or be represented.
Duty: Must notify a data management plan prepared according to open and responsible data governance, taking into account current international practice.
Duty: Must automatically generate a “BBNJ” standardized batch identifier upon receipt of the prior notification.
Duty: Must notify updated information upon material change prior to collection, within a reasonable period and no later than the start of collection in situ, when practicable.

Duty: Must notify specified post-collection information (incl. repository/database locations, deposit of samples, area/depth report, updates to data management plan) as soon as available, and no later than one year from collection in situ.

Duty: Must ensure samples/DSI in repositories or databases under their jurisdiction can be identified as originating from ABNJ, in accordance with current international practice and to the extent practicable.

Duty: Must ensure repositories (to the extent practicable) and databases under their jurisdiction prepare biennial aggregate reports linked to the “BBNJ” batch identifier and make them available to the ABS Committee.

Duty: Must ensure notification (as soon as available) of where results of utilization (e.g., publications; patents granted, if available and to the extent possible; products developed) can be found, including the “BBNJ” identifier if available.
Duty: Must ensure notification of details of the post-collection notification related to utilized MGR.
Duty: Must ensure notification of where the original MGR sample is held.
Duty: Must ensure notification of access modalities for MGR/DSI being utilized and a data management plan for the same.
Duty: Must take measures to ensure access to TK of ABNJ held by IPLCs only with FPIC/approval and involvement, and that access/use is on mutually agreed terms.
Liberty: May facilitate access to such traditional knowledge.
Duty: Must ensure benefits from utilization of MGR/DSI of ABNJ are shared fairly and equitably in accordance with this Part.
Duty: Must share non-monetary benefits in the forms listed (e.g., access to samples/DSI, FAIR data, technology transfer, capacity-building).
Duty: Must ensure MGR/DSI subject to utilization are deposited in publicly accessible repositories/databases within timelines set.
Liberty: May subject access to MGR/DSI in repositories/databases under its jurisdiction to reasonable conditions.
Duty: Must share monetary benefits fairly and equitably through the financial mechanism under Article 52.
Duty: Must make annual contributions to the special fund referred to in Article 52 until COP decides otherwise.
Power: May decide modalities for sharing monetary benefits (3/4 majority if consensus fails).
Power: May declare that adopted modalities shall not take effect for up to four years for that Party.
Duty: Shall review and assess biennially the monetary benefits and related contributions; first review within five years of entry into force.
Power: Elects members of the ABS Committee nominated by Parties; determines its terms of reference and modalities.
Power: May nominate members to the ABS Committee.
Power: May make recommendations to the COP on guidelines, measures and rates/modalities under Part II.
Duty: Must make required ABS information available to the ABS Committee through the Clearing-House.
Power: May exchange information with relevant legal instruments/frameworks and relevant bodies.
Power: May make recommendations to the COP based on information obtained.
Power: Adopts procedures for monitoring/transparency (incl. use of “BBNJ” batch identifiers) as recommended by the ABS Committee.
Power: Recommends procedures for monitoring/transparency to the COP.
Duty: Shall periodically submit reports on implementation of Part II to the ABS Committee.
Duty: Shall prepare a report (based on CHM info), make it available to Parties, and submit it for COP consideration.
Liberty: May submit comments on the ABS Committee report.
Power: May determine appropriate guidelines for implementing Article 16, taking into account Parties’ capacities and circumstances.
Disability: Shall not consider for decision proposals that include any areas within national jurisdiction.
Disability: Shall not rely on ABMT/MPA establishment as a basis for asserting or denying sovereignty, sovereign rights or jurisdiction.
Liberty: May submit proposals for ABMTs/MPAs to the Secretariat, individually or collectively.
Duty: Shall collaborate and consult, as appropriate, with relevant stakeholders for the development of proposals.
Duty: Shall formulate proposals on the basis of best available science and, where available, relevant traditional knowledge.
Duty: Shall include specified key elements (e.g., spatial description, criteria, activities, state of environment, draft measures/plan) in proposals.
Duty: Shall make proposals publicly available and transmit them for preliminary review.
Duty: Shall conduct a preliminary review to ascertain required information is included.
Duty: Shall retransmit the proposal taking into account the preliminary review.
Duty: Shall notify Parties, make the retransmitted proposal public, and facilitate consultations under Article 21.
Duty: Shall facilitate inclusive, transparent consultations and gather input on proposals.
Liberty: May submit views and information during consultations (notified/invited).
Liberty: May submit views and information within their competence during consultations (invited).
Liberty: May submit views and other relevant information during consultations (invited).
Duty: Shall take into account comments and, as appropriate, revise the proposal or respond to substantive contributions.
Duty: Shall assess the revised proposal and make recommendations.
Power: May elaborate modalities for consultation and assessment for COP consideration and adoption.
Power: Shall take decisions on the establishment of ABMTs/MPAs and related measures.
Power: May take decisions on measures compatible with those of relevant instruments/frameworks/bodies.
Duty: Shall make arrangements for regular consultations to enhance cooperation and coordination with and among relevant bodies.
Power: May adopt binding decisions/recommendations (consensus; voting rules apply) that enter into force after 120 days.
Power: May object in writing within 120 days on specified grounds.
Duty: Shall, to the extent practicable, adopt alternative measures equivalent in effect and not undermine decision effectiveness.
Power: Shall adopt emergency measures, if necessary, to prevent exacerbation of serious or irreversible harm in ABNJ.
Power: May elaborate procedures and guidance for emergency measures for COP consideration/adoption.
Duty: Shall ensure ABNJ activities under its jurisdiction/control are conducted consistently with decisions adopted under this Part.
Liberty: May adopt more stringent measures with respect to its nationals/vessels or activities under its jurisdiction/control, in accordance with international law.
Duty: Shall cooperate in conservation and sustainable use of BBNJ even if not member/participant in relevant bodies or measures.
Duty: Shall report to the COP on implementation of ABMTs/MPAs and related measures.
Duty: Shall make Parties’ reports and related information/reviews publicly available.
Liberty: May provide information to the COP on measures they have adopted to achieve objectives.
Duty: Shall monitor and periodically review implementation and provide advice and recommendations.
Power: May take decisions/recommendations to amend, extend or revoke ABMTs/MPAs and related measures.
Duty: Shall ensure EIA is conducted for planned ABNJ activities under its jurisdiction or control before authorization.
Duty: Shall ensure EIA for activities within national jurisdiction that may cause significant harmful changes in ABNJ.
Duty: Shall promote use of EIAs and adoption/implementation of Article 38 standards/guidelines in relevant bodies.
Power: Shall develop mechanisms for STB collaboration with relevant bodies under this Part.
Duty: Shall conduct screening using specified factors when effects may be more than minor or transitory or are unknown/poorly understood.
Duty: Shall undertake screening and make determination publicly available, including through the Clearing-House Mechanism.
Duty: Shall identify/assess measures to prevent, mitigate and manage potential adverse effects and, where appropriate, incorporate them into an environmental management plan.
Duty: Shall ensure timely public notification of planned activities and time-bound opportunities for participation throughout the EIA process.
Duty: Shall consult adjacent Coastal States and provide written responses addressing their comments, including on potential impacts in areas within national jurisdiction.
Duty: Shall ensure preparation of an EIA report that includes the minimum required information.
Duty: Shall determine if the planned activity may proceed, taking full account of the EIA, and authorize only after ensuring prevention of significant adverse impacts.
Duty: Shall make decision documents public, including through the Clearing-House Mechanism.
Power: May provide advice and assistance to a Party upon request when determining whether a planned activity may proceed.
Duty: Shall monitor environmental and associated impacts of authorized activities under conditions of approval, using best available science and, where available, relevant traditional knowledge.
Duty: Shall periodically report on impacts of authorized activities and monitoring results under Article 35.
Duty: Shall make monitoring reports public, including through the Clearing-House Mechanism.
Duty: Shall consider monitoring reports for the purpose of developing guidelines on monitoring of impacts of authorized activities.
Duty: Shall ensure that impacts monitored under Article 35 are reviewed.

Duty: Upon identifying significant unforeseen adverse impacts or breach of conditions, shall review the authorization decision and notify COP, other Parties and the public, including through the Clearing-House Mechanism.
actoraffected: COP; Other Contracting Parties; Stakeholders; Clearing-House

action: Duty: Shall require modification, mitigation or cessation of the activity, as appropriate.
Power: May suspend the activity.
Duty: Shall consult potentially most affected States and keep stakeholders informed through the Clearing-House; stakeholders may be consulted in monitoring, reporting and review.
Duty: Shall publish, including through the Clearing-House Mechanism, (a) review reports and (b) decision documents (with reasons) when a decision is changed.
Duty: Shall develop standards or guidelines on EIA matters (e.g., thresholds, report content, consultation, alternatives) for COP consideration and adoption.
Power: May adopt standards as annexes to the Agreement in accordance with Article 74.
Duty: Shall consider conducting strategic environmental assessments for relevant plans and programmes in ABNJ.
Power: May conduct a strategic environmental assessment of an area or region.
Duty: Shall take into account results of relevant strategic environmental assessments when undertaking EIAs.
Duty: Shall develop guidance on the conduct of each category of strategic environmental assessment.
Duty: Shall cooperate to assist Parties, in particular developing States Parties, through capacity-building and the development and transfer of marine technology.
Duty: Shall cooperate at all levels and in all forms, including partnerships with stakeholders, such as the private sector, civil society, and IPLCs.

Duty: Shall give full recognition to the special requirements of developing States Parties (incl. least developed, landlocked, geographically disadvantaged, small island developing States, coastal African, archipelagic, and developing middle-income States) and ensure support is not conditional on onerous reporting.
actoraffected: Developing States; Small Island and Vulnerable Countries

action: Duty: Within capabilities, shall ensure capacity-building for developing States Parties and shall cooperate to achieve the transfer of marine technology.
Duty: Shall provide, within capabilities, resources to support capacity-building and the development and transfer of marine technology and facilitate access to other sources of support.
Duty: Shall ensure capacity-building/technology transfer is country-driven, transparent, effective, iterative, participatory, cross-cutting and gender-responsive, building on existing programmes.
Duty: Shall base capacity-building/technology transfer on needs/priorities of developing States Parties identified through needs assessments.
Power: May facilitate needs assessments for developing States Parties.
Power: May facilitate needs assessments for developing States Parties.
Duty: Shall ensure transfer of marine technology on fair and most favourable terms, including concessional and preferential terms, and in accordance with mutually agreed terms.
Duty: Shall take into account rights over technologies and show due regard for legitimate interests of holders, suppliers and recipients.
actoraffected: Private Sector; Resource-Providing Party; Receiving Party

action: Duty: Shall ensure technology transferred is appropriate, relevant, reliable, affordable, up to date, environmentally sound and accessible for developing States Parties.
Liberty: May provide the indicative types of capacity-building and technology transfer listed (non-exhaustive).
Duty: Shall periodically review, assess and further develop/provide guidance on the indicative types, taking account of committee recommendations.
Duty: Shall carry out monitoring and review of capacity-building/technology transfer under COP authority.
Duty: Shall submit reports to the Capacity-Building and Technology Transfer Committee (format/intervals set by COP).
Duty: Shall ensure reporting requirements are streamlined and not onerous, in particular for developing States Parties.
Power: Elects members of the Capacity-Building and Technology Transfer Committee and decides its terms of reference and modalities.
Power: May nominate members to the Capacity-Building and Technology Transfer Committee.
Duty: Shall submit reports and recommendations for COP consideration/action.
Power: Adopt decisions and recommendations related to the implementation of the Agreement.
Duty: Promote cooperation and coordination with and among relevant legal instruments/frameworks and relevant global, regional, subregional and sectoral bodies.
Power: Establish subsidiary bodies as deemed necessary to support implementation.
Power: Adopt a budget by a three-fourths majority if consensus efforts are exhausted.
Duty: Periodically assess/review adequacy and effectiveness of Agreement provisions and propose means to strengthen implementation.
Duty: Promote transparency in decision-making processes and other activities under the Agreement.
Duty: Ensure meetings are open to observers unless decided otherwise and publish/maintain a public record of decisions.
Duty: Provide modalities for observer participation and timely access to information; rules shall not be unduly restrictive.
Power: Elect members of the Scientific and Technical Body and determine its terms of reference and modalities.
Power: May nominate members to the Scientific and Technical Body.
Duty: Provide scientific and technical advice to the COP, perform assigned functions and report on its work.
Power: May seek information from relevant instruments/frameworks/bodies and from other scientists and experts.
Power: Make arrangements for the functioning of the Secretariat, including deciding its seat, at the first COP meeting.
Duty: Provide assistance with implementation and perform other functions as determined by the COP or assigned under the Agreement.
Duty: Shall serve as a centralized open-access platform to enable Parties to access, provide and disseminate information specified under this Agreement.
Power: May determine the specific modalities for the operation of the Clearing-House Mechanism.
Duty: Shall manage the Clearing-House Mechanism.
Duty: Shall foster enhanced transparency and facilitate international cooperation and collaboration, including scientific and technical cooperation.
Duty: Shall, within its capabilities, provide resources for activities intended to achieve the objectives of the Agreement.
Duty: Shall fund institutions established under the Agreement through assessed contributions.
Power: May consider establishing additional funds as part of the financial mechanism.
Duty: Shall take the necessary legislative, administrative or policy measures to ensure implementation of the Agreement.
Duty: Shall monitor implementation of its obligations under the Agreement.
Duty: Shall report to the COP, in the format and at intervals determined by the COP, on measures taken to implement the Agreement.
Power: Elects members of the Implementation and Compliance Committee nominated by Parties.
Power: May nominate members to the Implementation and Compliance Committee.
Power: Adopts the modalities and rules of procedure for the Implementation and Compliance Committee.
Duty: Shall consider issues of implementation and compliance and report/recommend to the COP.
Power: May draw on appropriate information from bodies established under the Agreement and from relevant instruments/frameworks and bodies.
Duty: Shall cooperate in order to prevent disputes.
Duty: Shall settle disputes by peaceful means (negotiation, inquiry, mediation, conciliation, arbitration, judicial settlement, regional arrangements, or other peaceful means).
Liberty: May agree at any time to settle a dispute by any peaceful means of their own choice.
Liberty: May refer a technical dispute to an ad hoc expert panel established by them.
Duty: Shall settle disputes in accordance with the procedures provided for in Part XV of the Convention.
Power: May choose, by written declaration, one or more procedures (ITLOS, ICJ, Annex VII arbitration, Annex VIII special arbitration) for dispute settlement.
Duty: Shall make every effort to enter into provisional arrangements of a practical nature pending settlement of the dispute.
Duty: Shall encourage non-parties to this Agreement to become Parties thereto.
Duty: Shall fulfil obligations in good faith and exercise rights in a manner that would not constitute an abuse of right.
Liberty: May vote (one vote per Party).
Power: May apply the Agreement provisionally by written notification at the time of signature or of deposit of an instrument of ratification, approval, acceptance or accession.
Disability: Cannot make reservations or exceptions to this Agreement unless expressly permitted by other articles.
Disability: Declarations or statements shall not purport to exclude or modify the legal effect of the Agreement’s provisions.
Power: May propose amendments by written communication addressed to the Secretariat.
Duty: Shall circulate proposed amendments to all Parties.
Power: May adopt amendments in accordance with Article 47.
Power: May denounce this Agreement by written notification; denunciation takes effect after the specified period.
Power: May amend annexes; annex procedures on proposal/adoption/entry into force apply as provided.
Power: May propose an amendment to any annex for consideration at the next COP meeting.
